title: Smooth Multi-period Quantile Regression
text: can install development version smoothqr GitHub :

title: Smooth Multi-period Quantile Regression
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example: case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(smoothqr) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
title: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
text: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients

title: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
code: # S3 method for smoothrq coef(object, type = c("response", "smoothed"), ...)

title: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
text: object object extraction model coefficients     meaningful. type option `response` means smoothing inverted, giving \(\Theta H'\). result List containing one matrix response. Alternatively, choosing `smoothed` return \(\Theta\) List containing one matrix degree. ... used.

title: Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
Extract smoothed quantile regression model coefficients — coef.smoothrq
code: x <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) y <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) out <- smooth_rq(x, y, tau = c(.25, .5, .75)) cc1 <- coef(out) cc2 <- coef(out, "smoothed")

what: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
title: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
text: Make predictions smoothed multi-output quantile regression

title: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
code: # S3 method for smoothrq predict(object, newdata, ...)

title: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
text: object Object class inheriting `smooth_rq` newdata matrix data frame look variables predict. May omitted. ... used

title: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
text: List predicted values, one matrix per response.

title: Make predictions from a smoothed multi-output quantile regression — predict.smoothrq
code: x <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) y <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) out <- smooth_rq(x, y, tau = c(.25, .5, .75)) p <- predict(out, newdata = x[1:10, ])

title: Smoothed multi-response quantile regression — smooth_rq
code: smooth_rq(   x,   y,   tau = 0.5,   degree = 3L,   intercept = TRUE,   aheads = 1:n_models,   ... )

title: Smoothed multi-response quantile regression — smooth_rq
text: x numeric matrix data.frame predictors. intercept included. y numeric matrix data.frame response values tau quantile(s) estimated. number (vector values) strictly 0 1. degree number polynomials used response smoothing. Must number columns y. intercept logical. model estimated intercept aheads Defaults vector `1:ncol(y)` responses observed different spacing (appear different order), information used . ... additional arguments passed `[quantreg::rq]` allowed.

title: Smoothed multi-response quantile regression — smooth_rq
code: x <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) y <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 10), nrow = 100) out <- smooth_rq(x, y, tau = c(.25, .5, .75))
